image_and_persona.description: A street-level savage with a chip on his shell, Raph the Red brings that underground grime straight from the sewer. Always in a red bandana, hoodie torn at the sleeves, gold grill with a sai engraved, and Timberlands splashed with sewer sludge. He's got that lone wolf energy — intense, unpredictable, and always ready to battle. Think Wu-Tang fury meets Brooklyn vigilante.

musical_style.description: Gritty East Coast Battle Rap with punk undertones. Dark, sample-heavy beats layered with sirens, subway rumbles, and nunchuck percussion. Influences: DMX, Mobb Deep, Onyx, and early Joey Bada$$ — but with sewer smoke.

themes: Loyalty to the crew, but beef with authority
Street survival with a mutant twist

speech_characteristics.delivery: Aggressive, gravel-voiced flow with minimal hooks
speech_characteristics.structure: Heavy use of street slang and ninja metaphors
speech_characteristics.style: Punchlines that cut like a sai to the gut
signature_phrases: Step in my sewer, you swimmin' in pain
You talk tough — I trained in the shadows
